definition: flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc

sentences.english: People are clapping, slapping their thighs, stomping the floor.
sentences.chinese: 人们鼓掌，拍着大腿，跺着地板。

sentences.english: Last night, I stomped into our bedroom ready to turn on my anger at full volume.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，我跺着脚进卧室，准备大发雷霆。

sentences.english: The takedown is immediately followed by a straight-legged downward stomp of the opponent's head with the heel.
sentences.chinese: 摔倒对手后，立即用足跟直腿跺踩对手头部。

sentences.english: In addition, there are 'obstacle-walls' built perpendicular to the parapets.
sentences.chinese: 另外还有一些障碍墙与矮跺垂直建造。

sentences.english: He tucked the bassoon under an arm and stamped out.
sentences.chinese: 他把巴松管夹在腋下，跺着脚走了出去。

sentences.english: Ground Stomp is foot-stomping skill, stuns and knocks back monsters in a small radius around the barbarian.
sentences.chinese: 用脚跺地，击退小半径内的怪物并造成晕眩。

sentences.english: The black cat kept drubbing on the ground with its white paws.
sentences.chinese: 那只黑猫不停地用白爪子跺地。

sentences.english: When I caught one, I would stomp on it and squash it. Kill it dead.
sentences.chinese: 当我抓住一个，我就狠狠跺几脚，然后捏碎，杀死它。

sentences.english: You stomp too hard and you'll fall in it.
sentences.chinese: 你跺脚跺的太重了，你会掉下去的。

sentences.english: The horse snorted and stamped its hoof impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 这匹马呼哧呼哧地喷着气，不耐烦地跺着蹄子。

sentences.english: But they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came unto Iconium.
sentences.chinese: 二人对着众人跺下脚上的尘土，就往以哥念去了。

sentences.english: He stamped his feet to shake the snow off his boots.
sentences.chinese: 他跺着脚摇落靴子上的雪。

definition: to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
to beat with the fist/to hammer/to cudgel
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
variant of 憤憤|愤愤[fen4 fen4]
